intro: Gonzalagunia stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stalked gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are simple and ovate, often with a hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Gonzalagunia stenostachya is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
